node.title: Juana Molina – Paraguaya Punk
node.content:
Regardless of being a veteran, Argentinian musician Juana Molina has never ceased to amaze with original yet very approachable ideas in music.

Molina is one of the few heroes that show that you don’t have to turn into a legacy act just because you get older. The lucid understanding and the use of new technology have been and still are a defining mark on her original approach to musical composition and performance.

In this hand-drawn animation video of a punk version of her song Paraguaya taken from the 2017 album Halo we once again witness Molina’s clever musical ideas and youthful energy.

node.title: King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard – Honey
node.content:
This week’s Video of the week slot goes to the hyper-productive King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard and their depiction of Melbourne at nightfall.

We have to be honest here, we were a bit alienated by their previous releases Fishing for Fishies and Infest the Rats’ Nest. Yet, with this new video they seem to get back on the “right” path.

In the meanwhile, King Gizzard released another video Some of Us in which they reminds us of the problems the world had before the Covid-19 crisis. Despite the pandemics, humanity is still destined for extinction.

node.title: Vessels – The Sky Was Pink
node.content: Vessels – The Sky Was Pink (2012) A cover of James Holden’s remix of Nathan Fake’s classic.
